alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 7:23AM EDT until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens affecting Macomb County. Clinton River Near Clinton Township affecting Macomb County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 6.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Impact...At 15.0 feet, Agricultural land along the river begins to flood. When the river reaches this level due to rain, the Middle Branch Clinton River usually is flooding in some locations. The middle branch will crest about 24 hours earlier than the north branch. 21 and 22 Mile Roads may be flooded. Water could also reach the foundation of a few homes along the bank of the middle branch by Heyndrich and Cass Avenue. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
